module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.AttackSummary

-- | Summarizes all DDoS attacks for a specified time period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AttackSummary
AttackSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AttackVectorDescription] -> AttackSummary

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the resource that was attacked.
[$sel:resourceArn:AttackSummary'] :: AttackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The start time of the attack, in Unix time in seconds. For more
--   information see <a>timestamp</a>.
[$sel:startTime:AttackSummary'] :: AttackSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The end time of the attack, in Unix time in seconds. For more
--   information see <a>timestamp</a>.
[$sel:endTime:AttackSummary'] :: AttackSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the attack.
[$sel:attackId:AttackSummary'] :: AttackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of attacks for a specified time period.
[$sel:attackVectors:AttackSummary'] :: AttackSummary -> Maybe [AttackVectorDescription]

--   <a>attackSummary_attackVectors</a> - The list of attacks for a
--   specified time period.

module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.AttackVolume

-- | Information about the volume of attacks during the time period,
--   included in an AttackStatisticsDataItem. If the accompanying
--   <tt>AttackCount</tt> in the statistics object is zero, this setting
--   might be empty.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackVolume</a> smart constructor.
data AttackVolume
AttackVolume' :: Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics -> Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics -> Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics -> AttackVolume

-- | A statistics object that uses packets per second as the unit. This is
--   included for network level attacks.
[$sel:packetsPerSecond:AttackVolume'] :: AttackVolume -> Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics

-- | A statistics object that uses bits per second as the unit. This is
--   included for network level attacks.
[$sel:bitsPerSecond:AttackVolume'] :: AttackVolume -> Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics

-- | A statistics object that uses requests per second as the unit. This is
--   included for application level attacks, and is only available for
--   accounts that are subscribed to Shield Advanced.
[$sel:requestsPerSecond:AttackVolume'] :: AttackVolume -> Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:packetsPerSecond:AttackVolume'</a>,
--   <a>attackVolume_packetsPerSecond</a> - A statistics object that uses
--   packets per second as the unit. This is included for network level
--   attacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitsPerSecond:AttackVolume'</a>,
--   <a>attackVolume_bitsPerSecond</a> - A statistics object that uses bits
--   per second as the unit. This is included for network level attacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestsPerSecond:AttackVolume'</a>,
--   <a>attackVolume_requestsPerSecond</a> - A statistics object that uses
--   requests per second as the unit. This is included for application
--   level attacks, and is only available for accounts that are subscribed
--   to Shield Advanced.
newAttackVolume :: AttackVolume

-- | A statistics object that uses packets per second as the unit. This is
--   included for network level attacks.
attackVolume_packetsPerSecond :: Lens' AttackVolume (Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics)

-- | A statistics object that uses bits per second as the unit. This is
--   included for network level attacks.
attackVolume_bitsPerSecond :: Lens' AttackVolume (Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics)

-- | A statistics object that uses requests per second as the unit. This is
--   included for application level attacks, and is only available for
--   accounts that are subscribed to Shield Advanced.
attackVolume_requestsPerSecond :: Lens' AttackVolume (Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.AttackVolume.AttackVolume
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.AttackVolume.AttackVolume
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.AttackVolume.AttackVolume
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.AttackVolume.AttackVolume

module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.AttackStatisticsDataItem

-- | A single attack statistics data record. This is returned by
--   DescribeAttackStatistics along with a time range indicating the time
--   period that the attack statistics apply to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackStatisticsDataItem</a> smart constructor.
data AttackStatisticsDataItem
AttackStatisticsDataItem' :: Maybe AttackVolume -> Integer -> AttackStatisticsDataItem

-- | Information about the volume of attacks during the time period. If the
--   accompanying <tt>AttackCount</tt> is zero, this setting might be
--   empty.
[$sel:attackVolume:AttackStatisticsDataItem'] :: AttackStatisticsDataItem -> Maybe AttackVolume

-- | The number of attacks detected during the time period. This is always
--   present, but might be zero.
[$sel:attackCount:AttackStatisticsDataItem'] :: AttackStatisticsDataItem -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackStatisticsDataItem</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackVolume:AttackStatisticsDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>attackStatisticsDataItem_attackVolume</a> - Information about the
--   volume of attacks during the time period. If the accompanying
--   <tt>AttackCount</tt> is zero, this setting might be empty.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackCount:AttackStatisticsDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>attackStatisticsDataItem_attackCount</a> - The number of attacks
--   detected during the time period. This is always present, but might be
--   zero.
newAttackStatisticsDataItem :: Integer -> AttackStatisticsDataItem

-- | Information about the volume of attacks during the time period. If the
--   accompanying <tt>AttackCount</tt> is zero, this setting might be
--   empty.
attackStatisticsDataItem_attackVolume :: Lens' AttackStatisticsDataItem (Maybe AttackVolume)

-- | The number of attacks detected during the time period. This is always
--   present, but might be zero.
attackStatisticsDataItem_attackCount :: Lens' AttackStatisticsDataItem Integer

module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Contributor

-- | A contributor to the attack and their contribution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContributor</a> smart constructor.
data Contributor
Contributor' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Contributor

-- | The name of the contributor. This is dependent on the
--   <tt>AttackPropertyIdentifier</tt>. For example, if the
--   <tt>AttackPropertyIdentifier</tt> is <tt>SOURCE_COUNTRY</tt>, the
--   <tt>Name</tt> could be <tt>United States</tt>.
[$sel:name:Contributor'] :: Contributor -> Maybe Text

-- | The contribution of this contributor expressed in Protection units.
--   For example <tt>10,000</tt>.
[$sel:value:Contributor'] :: Contributor -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Contributor</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Contributor'</a>, <a>contributor_name</a> - The name of
--   the contributor. This is dependent on the
--   <tt>AttackPropertyIdentifier</tt>. For example, if the
--   <tt>AttackPropertyIdentifier</tt> is <tt>SOURCE_COUNTRY</tt>, the
--   <tt>Name</tt> could be <tt>United States</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Contributor'</a>, <a>contributor_value</a> - The
--   contribution of this contributor expressed in Protection units. For
--   example <tt>10,000</tt>.
newContributor :: Contributor

-- | The name of the contributor. This is dependent on the
--   <tt>AttackPropertyIdentifier</tt>. For example, if the
--   <tt>AttackPropertyIdentifier</tt> is <tt>SOURCE_COUNTRY</tt>, the
--   <tt>Name</tt> could be <tt>United States</tt>.
contributor_name :: Lens' Contributor (Maybe Text)

-- | The contribution of this contributor expressed in Protection units.
--   For example <tt>10,000</tt>.
contributor_value :: Lens' Contributor (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Contributor.Contributor
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Contributor.Contributor
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Contributor.Contributor
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Contributor.Contributor
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Contributor.Contributor
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Contributor.Contributor
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Contributor.Contributor


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact

-- | Contact information that the SRT can use to contact you if you have
--   proactive engagement enabled, for escalations to the SRT and to
--   initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmergencyContact</a> smart constructor.
data EmergencyContact
EmergencyContact' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> EmergencyContact

-- | The phone number for the contact.
[$sel:phoneNumber:EmergencyContact'] :: EmergencyContact -> Maybe Text

-- | Additional notes regarding the contact.
[$sel:contactNotes:EmergencyContact'] :: EmergencyContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The email address for the contact.
[$sel:emailAddress:EmergencyContact'] :: EmergencyContact -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EmergencyContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:EmergencyContact'</a>,
--   <a>emergencyContact_phoneNumber</a> - The phone number for the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactNotes:EmergencyContact'</a>,
--   <a>emergencyContact_contactNotes</a> - Additional notes regarding the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailAddress:EmergencyContact'</a>,
--   <a>emergencyContact_emailAddress</a> - The email address for the
--   contact.
newEmergencyContact :: Text -> EmergencyContact

-- | The phone number for the contact.
emergencyContact_phoneNumber :: Lens' EmergencyContact (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional notes regarding the contact.
emergencyContact_contactNotes :: Lens' EmergencyContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The email address for the contact.
emergencyContact_emailAddress :: Lens' EmergencyContact Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact.EmergencyContact
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact.EmergencyContact
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact.EmergencyContact
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact.EmergencyContact
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact.EmergencyContact
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact.EmergencyContact
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact.EmergencyContact
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.EmergencyContact.EmergencyContact


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Limit

-- | Specifies how many protections of a given type you can create.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLimit</a> smart constructor.
data Limit
Limit' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Limit

-- | The maximum number of protections that can be created for the
--   specified <tt>Type</tt>.
[$sel:max:Limit'] :: Limit -> Maybe Integer

-- | The type of protection.
[$sel:type':Limit'] :: Limit -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Limit</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:max:Limit'</a>, <a>limit_max</a> - The maximum number of
--   protections that can be created for the specified <tt>Type</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Limit'</a>, <a>limit_type</a> - The type of protection.
newLimit :: Limit

-- | The maximum number of protections that can be created for the
--   specified <tt>Type</tt>.
limit_max :: Lens' Limit (Maybe Integer)

-- | The type of protection.
limit_type :: Lens' Limit (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Limit.Limit
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Limit.Limit
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Limit.Limit
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Limit.Limit
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Limit.Limit
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Limit.Limit
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Limit.Limit


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Mitigation

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigation</a> smart constructor.

module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Protection

-- | An object that represents a resource that is under DDoS protection.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtection</a> smart constructor.
data Protection
Protection' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Protection

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Amazon Web Services resource
--   that is protected.
[$sel:resourceArn:Protection'] :: Protection -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the protection.
[$sel:protectionArn:Protection'] :: Protection -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the protection.
[$sel:id:Protection'] :: Protection -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the protection. For example, <tt>My CloudFront
--   distributions</tt>.
[$sel:name:Protection'] :: Protection -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Route 53 health check that's
--   associated with the protection.
[$sel:healthCheckIds:Protection'] :: Protection -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Protection</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:Protection'</a>, <a>protection_resourceArn</a> -
--   The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Amazon Web Services resource
--   that is protected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionArn:Protection'</a>, <a>protection_protectionArn</a>
--   - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the protection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Protection'</a>, <a>protection_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of the protection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Protection'</a>, <a>protection_name</a> - The name of the
--   protection. For example, <tt>My CloudFront distributions</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheckIds:Protection'</a>,
--   <a>protection_healthCheckIds</a> - The unique identifier (ID) for the
--   Route 53 health check that's associated with the protection.
newProtection :: Protection

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Amazon Web Services resource
--   that is protected.
protection_resourceArn :: Lens' Protection (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the protection.
protection_protectionArn :: Lens' Protection (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the protection.
protection_id :: Lens' Protection (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the protection. For example, <tt>My CloudFront
--   distributions</tt>.
protection_name :: Lens' Protection (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Route 53 health check that's
--   associated with the protection.
protection_healthCheckIds :: Lens' Protection (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Protection.Protection
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Protection.Protection
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Protection.Protection
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Protection.Protection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Protection.Protection
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Protection.Protection
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Protection.Protection


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupAggregation
newtype ProtectionGroupAggregation
ProtectionGroupAggregation' :: Text -> ProtectionGroupAggregation
[fromProtectionGroupAggregation] :: ProtectionGroupAggregation -> Text
pattern ProtectionGroupAggregation_MAX :: ProtectionGroupAggregation
pattern ProtectionGroupAggregation_MEAN :: ProtectionGroupAggregation
pattern ProtectionGroupAggregation_SUM :: ProtectionGroupAggregation
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupAggregation.ProtectionGroupAggregation
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupAggregation.ProtectionGroupAggregation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupAggregation.ProtectionGroupAggregation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupAggregation.ProtectionGroupAggregation

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupAggregation.ProtectionGroupAggregation

module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits

-- | Limits settings on protection groups with arbitrary pattern type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits' :: Integer -> ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits

-- | The maximum number of resources you can specify for a single arbitrary
--   pattern in a protection group.
[$sel:maxMembers:ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits'] :: ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxMembers:ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits_maxMembers</a> - The maximum
--   number of resources you can specify for a single arbitrary pattern in
--   a protection group.
newProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits :: Integer -> ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits

-- | The maximum number of resources you can specify for a single arbitrary
--   pattern in a protection group.
protectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits_maxMembers :: Lens' ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits Integer
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits.ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPattern

pattern ProtectionGroupPattern_ALL :: ProtectionGroupPattern
pattern ProtectionGroupPattern_ARBITRARY :: ProtectionGroupPattern
pattern ProtectionGroupPattern_BY_RESOURCE_TYPE :: ProtectionGroupPattern
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPattern.ProtectionGroupPattern
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPattern.ProtectionGroupPattern

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPattern.ProtectionGroupPattern

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPattern.ProtectionGroupPattern
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPattern.ProtectionGroupPattern


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroup

-- | A grouping of protected resources that you and Shield Advanced can
--   monitor as a collective. This resource grouping improves the accuracy
--   of detection and reduces false positives.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectionGroup</a> smart constructor.
data ProtectionGroup
ProtectionGroup' :: Maybe ProtectedResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ProtectionGroupAggregation -> ProtectionGroupPattern -> [Text] -> ProtectionGroup

-- | The resource type to include in the protection group. All protected
--   resources of this type are included in the protection group. You must
--   set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to <tt>BY_RESOURCE_TYPE</tt>
--   and you must not set it for any other <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
[$sel:resourceType:ProtectionGroup'] :: ProtectionGroup -> Maybe ProtectedResourceType

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the protection group.
[$sel:protectionGroupArn:ProtectionGroup'] :: ProtectionGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the protection group. You use this to identify the
--   protection group in lists and to manage the protection group, for
--   example to update, delete, or describe it.
[$sel:protectionGroupId:ProtectionGroup'] :: ProtectionGroup -> Text

-- | Defines how Shield combines resource data for the group in order to
--   detect, mitigate, and report events.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Sum - Use the total traffic across the group. This is a good
--   choice for most cases. Examples include Elastic IP addresses for EC2
--   instances that scale manually or automatically.</li>
--   <li>Mean - Use the average of the traffic across the group. This is a
--   good choice for resources that share traffic uniformly. Examples
--   include accelerators and load balancers.</li>
--   <li>Max - Use the highest traffic from each resource. This is useful
--   for resources that don't share traffic and for resources that share
--   that traffic in a non-uniform way. Examples include Amazon CloudFront
--   distributions and origin resources for CloudFront distributions.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:aggregation:ProtectionGroup'] :: ProtectionGroup -> ProtectionGroupAggregation

-- | The criteria to use to choose the protected resources for inclusion in
--   the group. You can include all resources that have protections,
--   provide a list of resource Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), or include
--   all resources of a specified resource type.
[$sel:pattern':ProtectionGroup'] :: ProtectionGroup -> ProtectionGroupPattern

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the resources to include in the
--   protection group. You must set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to
--   <tt>ARBITRARY</tt> and you must not set it for any other
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
[$sel:members:ProtectionGroup'] :: ProtectionGroup -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtectionGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroup_resourceType</a> - The resource type to include in
--   the protection group. All protected resources of this type are
--   included in the protection group. You must set this when you set
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> to <tt>BY_RESOURCE_TYPE</tt> and you must not set it
--   for any other <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionGroupArn:ProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroup_protectionGroupArn</a> - The ARN (Amazon Resource
--   Name) of the protection group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionGroupId:ProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroup_protectionGroupId</a> - The name of the protection
--   group. You use this to identify the protection group in lists and to
--   manage the protection group, for example to update, delete, or
--   describe it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aggregation:ProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroup_aggregation</a> - Defines how Shield combines
--   resource data for the group in order to detect, mitigate, and report
--   events.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Sum - Use the total traffic across the group. This is a good
--   choice for most cases. Examples include Elastic IP addresses for EC2
--   instances that scale manually or automatically.</li>
--   <li>Mean - Use the average of the traffic across the group. This is a
--   good choice for resources that share traffic uniformly. Examples
--   include accelerators and load balancers.</li>
--   <li>Max - Use the highest traffic from each resource. This is useful
--   for resources that don't share traffic and for resources that share
--   that traffic in a non-uniform way. Examples include Amazon CloudFront
--   distributions and origin resources for CloudFront distributions.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:pattern':ProtectionGroup'</a>, <a>protectionGroup_pattern</a>
--   - The criteria to use to choose the protected resources for inclusion
--   in the group. You can include all resources that have protections,
--   provide a list of resource Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), or include
--   all resources of a specified resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:members:ProtectionGroup'</a>, <a>protectionGroup_members</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the resources to include in the
--   protection group. You must set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to
--   <tt>ARBITRARY</tt> and you must not set it for any other
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
newProtectionGroup :: Text -> ProtectionGroupAggregation -> ProtectionGroupPattern -> ProtectionGroup

-- | The resource type to include in the protection group. All protected
--   resources of this type are included in the protection group. You must
--   set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to <tt>BY_RESOURCE_TYPE</tt>
--   and you must not set it for any other <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
protectionGroup_resourceType :: Lens' ProtectionGroup (Maybe ProtectedResourceType)

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the protection group.
protectionGroup_protectionGroupArn :: Lens' ProtectionGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the protection group. You use this to identify the
--   protection group in lists and to manage the protection group, for
--   example to update, delete, or describe it.
protectionGroup_protectionGroupId :: Lens' ProtectionGroup Text

-- | Defines how Shield combines resource data for the group in order to
--   detect, mitigate, and report events.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Sum - Use the total traffic across the group. This is a good
--   choice for most cases. Examples include Elastic IP addresses for EC2
--   instances that scale manually or automatically.</li>
--   <li>Mean - Use the average of the traffic across the group. This is a
--   good choice for resources that share traffic uniformly. Examples
--   include accelerators and load balancers.</li>
--   <li>Max - Use the highest traffic from each resource. This is useful
--   for resources that don't share traffic and for resources that share
--   that traffic in a non-uniform way. Examples include Amazon CloudFront
--   distributions and origin resources for CloudFront distributions.</li>
--   </ul>
protectionGroup_aggregation :: Lens' ProtectionGroup ProtectionGroupAggregation

-- | The criteria to use to choose the protected resources for inclusion in
--   the group. You can include all resources that have protections,
--   provide a list of resource Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), or include
--   all resources of a specified resource type.
protectionGroup_pattern :: Lens' ProtectionGroup ProtectionGroupPattern

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the resources to include in the
--   protection group. You must set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to
--   <tt>ARBITRARY</tt> and you must not set it for any other
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
protectionGroup_members :: Lens' ProtectionGroup [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroup.ProtectionGroup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroup.ProtectionGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroup.ProtectionGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroup.ProtectionGroup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroup.ProtectionGroup
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroup.ProtectionGroup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroup.ProtectionGroup


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits

-- | Limits settings by pattern type in the protection groups for your
--   subscription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arbitraryPatternLimits:ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroupPatternTypeLimits_arbitraryPatternLimits</a> -
--   Limits settings on protection groups with arbitrary pattern type.
newProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits :: ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits -> ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits

-- | Limits settings on protection groups with arbitrary pattern type.
protectionGroupPatternTypeLimits_arbitraryPatternLimits :: Lens' ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits.ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits.ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits

module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionGroupLimits

-- | Limits settings on protection groups for your subscription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectionGroupLimits</a> smart constructor.
data ProtectionGroupLimits
ProtectionGroupLimits' :: Integer -> ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits -> ProtectionGroupLimits

--   subscription.

--   pattern type in the protection groups for your subscription.

module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.ProtectionLimits

module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionLimits

--

--   omitted.

--   protections for your subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionGroupLimits:SubscriptionLimits'</a>,
--   <a>subscriptionLimits_protectionGroupLimits</a> - Limits settings on
--   protection groups for your subscription.

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionLimits.SubscriptionLimits


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Subscription

-- | Information about the Shield Advanced subscription for an account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscription</a> smart constructor.
data Subscription
Subscription' :: Maybe AutoRenew -> Maybe ProactiveEngagementStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Limit] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> SubscriptionLimits -> Subscription

-- | If <tt>ENABLED</tt>, the subscription will be automatically renewed at
--   the end of the existing subscription period.
--   
--   When you initally create a subscription, <tt>AutoRenew</tt> is set to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt>. You can change this by submitting an
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request. If the
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request does not included a value for
--   <tt>AutoRenew</tt>, the existing value for <tt>AutoRenew</tt> remains
--   unchanged.
[$sel:autoRenew:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Maybe AutoRenew

-- | If <tt>ENABLED</tt>, the Shield Response Team (SRT) will use email and
--   phone to notify contacts about escalations to the SRT and to initiate
--   proactive customer support.
--   
--   If <tt>PENDING</tt>, you have requested proactive engagement and the
--   request is pending. The status changes to <tt>ENABLED</tt> when your
--   request is fully processed.
--   
--   If <tt>DISABLED</tt>, the SRT will not proactively notify contacts
--   about escalations or to initiate proactive customer support.
[$sel:proactiveEngagementStatus:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Maybe ProactiveEngagementStatus

-- | The start time of the subscription, in Unix time in seconds. For more
--   information see <a>timestamp</a>.
[$sel:startTime:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time your subscription will end.
[$sel:endTime:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies how many protections of a given type you can create.
[$sel:limits:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Maybe [Limit]

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the subscription.
[$sel:subscriptionArn:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The length, in seconds, of the Shield Advanced subscription for the
--   account.
[$sel:timeCommitmentInSeconds:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Limits settings for your subscription.
[$sel:subscriptionLimits:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> SubscriptionLimits

-- | Create a value of <a>Subscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoRenew:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_autoRenew</a> -
--   If <tt>ENABLED</tt>, the subscription will be automatically renewed at
--   the end of the existing subscription period.
--   
--   When you initally create a subscription, <tt>AutoRenew</tt> is set to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt>. You can change this by submitting an
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request. If the
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request does not included a value for
--   <tt>AutoRenew</tt>, the existing value for <tt>AutoRenew</tt> remains
--   unchanged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:proactiveEngagementStatus:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_proactiveEngagementStatus</a> - If <tt>ENABLED</tt>,
--   the Shield Response Team (SRT) will use email and phone to notify
--   contacts about escalations to the SRT and to initiate proactive
--   customer support.
--   
--   If <tt>PENDING</tt>, you have requested proactive engagement and the
--   request is pending. The status changes to <tt>ENABLED</tt> when your
--   request is fully processed.
--   
--   If <tt>DISABLED</tt>, the SRT will not proactively notify contacts
--   about escalations or to initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_startTime</a> -
--   The start time of the subscription, in Unix time in seconds. For more
--   information see <a>timestamp</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_endTime</a> - The
--   date and time your subscription will end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_limits</a> -
--   Specifies how many protections of a given type you can create.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionArn:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_subscriptionArn</a> - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name)
--   of the subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeCommitmentInSeconds:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_timeCommitmentInSeconds</a> - The length, in seconds,
--   of the Shield Advanced subscription for the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionLimits:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_subscriptionLimits</a> - Limits settings for your
--   subscription.
newSubscription :: SubscriptionLimits -> Subscription

-- | If <tt>ENABLED</tt>, the subscription will be automatically renewed at
--   the end of the existing subscription period.
--   
--   When you initally create a subscription, <tt>AutoRenew</tt> is set to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt>. You can change this by submitting an
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request. If the
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request does not included a value for
--   <tt>AutoRenew</tt>, the existing value for <tt>AutoRenew</tt> remains
--   unchanged.
subscription_autoRenew :: Lens' Subscription (Maybe AutoRenew)

-- | If <tt>ENABLED</tt>, the Shield Response Team (SRT) will use email and
--   phone to notify contacts about escalations to the SRT and to initiate
--   proactive customer support.
--   
--   If <tt>PENDING</tt>, you have requested proactive engagement and the
--   request is pending. The status changes to <tt>ENABLED</tt> when your
--   request is fully processed.
--   
--   If <tt>DISABLED</tt>, the SRT will not proactively notify contacts
--   about escalations or to initiate proactive customer support.
subscription_proactiveEngagementStatus :: Lens' Subscription (Maybe ProactiveEngagementStatus)

-- | The start time of the subscription, in Unix time in seconds. For more
--   information see <a>timestamp</a>.
subscription_startTime :: Lens' Subscription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time your subscription will end.
subscription_endTime :: Lens' Subscription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies how many protections of a given type you can create.
subscription_limits :: Lens' Subscription (Maybe [Limit])

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the subscription.
subscription_subscriptionArn :: Lens' Subscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The length, in seconds, of the Shield Advanced subscription for the
--   account.
subscription_timeCommitmentInSeconds :: Lens' Subscription (Maybe Natural)

-- | Limits settings for your subscription.
subscription_subscriptionLimits :: Lens' Subscription SubscriptionLimits
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Subscription.Subscription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Subscription.Subscription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Subscription.Subscription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Subscription.Subscription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Subscription.Subscription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Subscription.Subscription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Subscription.Subscription


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState
newtype SubscriptionState
SubscriptionState' :: Text -> SubscriptionState
[fromSubscriptionState] :: SubscriptionState -> Text
pattern SubscriptionState_ACTIVE :: SubscriptionState
pattern SubscriptionState_INACTIVE :: SubscriptionState
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState

instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedCounter

-- | The counter that describes a DDoS attack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSummarizedCounter</a> smart constructor.
data SummarizedCounter
SummarizedCounter' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> SummarizedCounter

-- | The number of counters for a specified time period.
[$sel:n:SummarizedCounter'] :: SummarizedCounter -> Maybe Int

-- | The unit of the counters.
[$sel:unit:SummarizedCounter'] :: SummarizedCounter -> Maybe Text

-- | The total of counter values for a specified time period.
[$sel:sum:SummarizedCounter'] :: SummarizedCounter -> Maybe Double

-- | The counter name.
[$sel:name:SummarizedCounter'] :: SummarizedCounter -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum value of the counter for a specified time period.
[$sel:max:SummarizedCounter'] :: SummarizedCounter -> Maybe Double

-- | The average value of the counter for a specified time period.
[$sel:average:SummarizedCounter'] :: SummarizedCounter -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>SummarizedCounter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:n:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_n</a> - The
--   number of counters for a specified time period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_unit</a> -
--   The unit of the counters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sum:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_sum</a> - The
--   total of counter values for a specified time period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_name</a> -
--   The counter name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:max:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_max</a> - The
--   maximum value of the counter for a specified time period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:average:SummarizedCounter'</a>,
--   <a>summarizedCounter_average</a> - The average value of the counter
--   for a specified time period.
newSummarizedCounter :: SummarizedCounter

-- | The number of counters for a specified time period.
summarizedCounter_n :: Lens' SummarizedCounter (Maybe Int)

-- | The unit of the counters.
summarizedCounter_unit :: Lens' SummarizedCounter (Maybe Text)

-- | The total of counter values for a specified time period.
summarizedCounter_sum :: Lens' SummarizedCounter (Maybe Double)

-- | The counter name.
summarizedCounter_name :: Lens' SummarizedCounter (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum value of the counter for a specified time period.
summarizedCounter_max :: Lens' SummarizedCounter (Maybe Double)

-- | The average value of the counter for a specified time period.
summarizedCounter_average :: Lens' SummarizedCounter (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedCounter.SummarizedCounter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedCounter.SummarizedCounter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedCounter.SummarizedCounter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedCounter.SummarizedCounter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedCounter.SummarizedCounter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedCounter.SummarizedCounter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedCounter.SummarizedCounter


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedAttackVector

-- | A summary of information about the attack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSummarizedAttackVector</a> smart constructor.
data SummarizedAttackVector
SummarizedAttackVector' :: Maybe [SummarizedCounter] -> Text -> SummarizedAttackVector

-- | The list of counters that describe the details of the attack.
[$sel:vectorCounters:SummarizedAttackVector'] :: SummarizedAttackVector -> Maybe [SummarizedCounter]

-- | The attack type, for example, SNMP reflection or SYN flood.
[$sel:vectorType:SummarizedAttackVector'] :: SummarizedAttackVector -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SummarizedAttackVector</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vectorCounters:SummarizedAttackVector'</a>,
--   <a>summarizedAttackVector_vectorCounters</a> - The list of counters
--   that describe the details of the attack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vectorType:SummarizedAttackVector'</a>,
--   <a>summarizedAttackVector_vectorType</a> - The attack type, for
--   example, SNMP reflection or SYN flood.
newSummarizedAttackVector :: Text -> SummarizedAttackVector

-- | The list of counters that describe the details of the attack.
summarizedAttackVector_vectorCounters :: Lens' SummarizedAttackVector (Maybe [SummarizedCounter])

-- | The attack type, for example, SNMP reflection or SYN flood.
summarizedAttackVector_vectorType :: Lens' SummarizedAttackVector Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedAttackVector.SummarizedAttackVector
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedAttackVector.SummarizedAttackVector
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedAttackVector.SummarizedAttackVector
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedAttackVector.SummarizedAttackVector
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedAttackVector.SummarizedAttackVector
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedAttackVector.SummarizedAttackVector
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SummarizedAttackVector.SummarizedAttackVector


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubResourceSummary

-- | The attack information for the specified SubResource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubResourceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data SubResourceSummary
SubResourceSummary' :: Maybe [SummarizedCounter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SubResourceType -> Maybe [SummarizedAttackVector] -> SubResourceSummary

-- | The counters that describe the details of the attack.
[$sel:counters:SubResourceSummary'] :: SubResourceSummary -> Maybe [SummarizedCounter]

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the <tt>SubResource</tt>.
[$sel:id:SubResourceSummary'] :: SubResourceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>SubResource</tt> type.
[$sel:type':SubResourceSummary'] :: SubResourceSummary -> Maybe SubResourceType

-- | The list of attack types and associated counters.
[$sel:attackVectors:SubResourceSummary'] :: SubResourceSummary -> Maybe [SummarizedAttackVector]

-- | Create a value of <a>SubResourceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:counters:SubResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>subResourceSummary_counters</a> - The counters that describe the
--   details of the attack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:SubResourceSummary'</a>, <a>subResourceSummary_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the <tt>SubResource</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SubResourceSummary'</a>, <a>subResourceSummary_type</a>
--   - The <tt>SubResource</tt> type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackVectors:SubResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>subResourceSummary_attackVectors</a> - The list of attack types and
--   associated counters.
newSubResourceSummary :: SubResourceSummary

-- | The counters that describe the details of the attack.
subResourceSummary_counters :: Lens' SubResourceSummary (Maybe [SummarizedCounter])

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the <tt>SubResource</tt>.
subResourceSummary_id :: Lens' SubResourceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>SubResource</tt> type.
subResourceSummary_type :: Lens' SubResourceSummary (Maybe SubResourceType)

-- | The list of attack types and associated counters.
subResourceSummary_attackVectors :: Lens' SubResourceSummary (Maybe [SummarizedAttackVector])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubResourceSummary.SubResourceSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubResourceSummary.SubResourceSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubResourceSummary.SubResourceSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubResourceSummary.SubResourceSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubResourceSummary.SubResourceSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubResourceSummary.SubResourceSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.SubResourceSummary.SubResourceSummary


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag

-- | A tag associated with an Amazon Web Services resource. Tags are
--   key:value pairs that you can use to categorize and manage your
--   resources, for purposes like billing or other management. Typically,
--   the tag key represents a category, such as "environment", and the tag
--   value represents a specific value within that category, such as
--   "test," "development," or "production". Or you might set the tag key
--   to "customer" and the value to the customer name or ID. You can
--   specify one or more tags to add to each Amazon Web Services resource,
--   up to 50 tags for a resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag key
--   to describe a category of information, such as "customer." Tag keys
--   are case-sensitive.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag value
--   to describe a specific value within a category, such as "companyA" or
--   "companyB." Tag values are case-sensitive.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Part of the key:value pair that
--   defines a tag. You can use a tag key to describe a category of
--   information, such as "customer." Tag keys are case-sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Part of the key:value pair
--   that defines a tag. You can use a tag value to describe a specific
--   value within a category, such as "companyA" or "companyB." Tag values
--   are case-sensitive.
newTag :: Tag

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag key
--   to describe a category of information, such as "customer." Tag keys
--   are case-sensitive.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag value
--   to describe a specific value within a category, such as "companyA" or
--   "companyB." Tag values are case-sensitive.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange

-- | The time range.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data TimeRange
TimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> TimeRange

-- | The start time, in Unix time in seconds. For more information see
--   <a>timestamp</a>.
[$sel:fromInclusive:TimeRange'] :: TimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The end time, in Unix time in seconds. For more information see
--   <a>timestamp</a>.
[$sel:toExclusive:TimeRange'] :: TimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeRange</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromInclusive:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_fromInclusive</a> -
--   The start time, in Unix time in seconds. For more information see
--   <a>timestamp</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toExclusive:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_toExclusive</a> - The
--   end time, in Unix time in seconds. For more information see
--   <a>timestamp</a>.
newTimeRange :: TimeRange

-- | The start time, in Unix time in seconds. For more information see
--   <a>timestamp</a>.
timeRange_fromInclusive :: Lens' TimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The end time, in Unix time in seconds. For more information see
--   <a>timestamp</a>.
timeRange_toExclusive :: Lens' TimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange


module Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit
newtype Unit
Unit' :: Text -> Unit
[fromUnit] :: Unit -> Text
pattern Unit_BITS :: Unit
pattern Unit_BYTES :: Unit
pattern Unit_PACKETS :: Unit
pattern Unit_REQUESTS :: Unit

instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.Types.Unit.Unit
