--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to add or
--   update tags for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - The tags that
--   you want to modify or add to the resource.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to add or
--   update tags for.
tagResource_resourceARN :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | The tags that you want to modify or add to the resource.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource [Tag]

--   this blank, Shield Advanced returns the first 20 results.
--

--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.

--   protection group in lists and to manage the protection group, for

-- | Lists all Protection objects for the account.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtections

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListProtections</a> smart constructor.
data ListProtections
ListProtections' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListProtections

-- | The <tt>ListProtectionsRequest.NextToken</tt> value from a previous
--   call to <tt>ListProtections</tt>. Pass null if this is the first call.
[$sel:nextToken:ListProtections'] :: ListProtections -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of Protection objects to return. If you leave this
--   blank, Shield Advanced returns the first 20 results.
--   
--   This is a maximum value. Shield Advanced might return the results in
--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.
[$sel:maxResults:ListProtections'] :: ListProtections -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListProtections</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListProtections'</a>,
--   <a>listProtections_nextToken</a> - The
--   <tt>ListProtectionsRequest.NextToken</tt> value from a previous call
--   to <tt>ListProtections</tt>. Pass null if this is the first call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListProtections'</a>,
--   <a>listProtections_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of Protection
--   objects to return. If you leave this blank, Shield Advanced returns
--   the first 20 results.
--   
--   This is a maximum value. Shield Advanced might return the results in
--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.
newListProtections :: ListProtections

-- | The <tt>ListProtectionsRequest.NextToken</tt> value from a previous
--   call to <tt>ListProtections</tt>. Pass null if this is the first call.
listProtections_nextToken :: Lens' ListProtections (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of Protection objects to return. If you leave this
--   blank, Shield Advanced returns the first 20 results.
--   
--   This is a maximum value. Shield Advanced might return the results in
--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.
listProtections_maxResults :: Lens' ListProtections (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListProtectionsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListProtectionsResponse
ListProtectionsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Protection] -> Int -> ListProtectionsResponse

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more
--   Protections than the value of MaxResults, Shield Advanced returns a
--   NextToken value in the response that allows you to list another group
--   of Protections. For the second and subsequent ListProtections
--   requests, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response to
--   get information about another batch of Protections.
--   
--   Shield Advanced might return the list of Protection objects in batches
--   smaller than the number specified by MaxResults. If there are more
--   Protection objects to return, Shield Advanced will always also return
--   a <tt>NextToken</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListProtectionsResponse'] :: ListProtectionsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The array of enabled Protection objects.
[$sel:protections:ListProtectionsResponse'] :: ListProtectionsResponse -> Maybe [Protection]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListProtectionsResponse'] :: ListProtectionsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListProtectionsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListProtections'</a>,
--   <a>listProtectionsResponse_nextToken</a> - If you specify a value for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more Protections than the value of
--   MaxResults, Shield Advanced returns a NextToken value in the response
--   that allows you to list another group of Protections. For the second
--   and subsequent ListProtections requests, specify the value of
--   NextToken from the previous response to get information about another
--   batch of Protections.
--   
--   Shield Advanced might return the list of Protection objects in batches
--   smaller than the number specified by MaxResults. If there are more
--   Protection objects to return, Shield Advanced will always also return
--   a <tt>NextToken</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protections:ListProtectionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listProtectionsResponse_protections</a> - The array of enabled
--   Protection objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListProtectionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listProtectionsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListProtectionsResponse :: Int -> ListProtectionsResponse

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more
--   Protections than the value of MaxResults, Shield Advanced returns a
--   NextToken value in the response that allows you to list another group
--   of Protections. For the second and subsequent ListProtections
--   requests, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response to
--   get information about another batch of Protections.
--   
--   Shield Advanced might return the list of Protection objects in batches
--   smaller than the number specified by MaxResults. If there are more
--   Protection objects to return, Shield Advanced will always also return
--   a <tt>NextToken</tt>.
listProtectionsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListProtectionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The array of enabled Protection objects.
listProtectionsResponse_protections :: Lens' ListProtectionsResponse (Maybe [Protection])

-- | The response's http status code.
listProtectionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListProtectionsResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtections.ListProtections
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtections.ListProtections
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtections.ListProtections
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtections.ListProtections
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtections.ListProtectionsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtections.ListProtectionsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtections.ListProtectionsResponse

-- | Retrieves the ProtectionGroup objects for the account.
module Network.AWS.Shield.ListProtectionGroups

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListProtectionGroups</a> smart constructor.
data ListProtectionGroups
ListProtectionGroups' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListProtectionGroups

-- | The next token value from a previous call to
--   <tt>ListProtectionGroups</tt>. Pass null if this is the first call.
[$sel:nextToken:ListProtectionGroups'] :: ListProtectionGroups -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of ProtectionGroup objects to return. If you leave
--   this blank, Shield Advanced returns the first 20 results.
--   
--   This is a maximum value. Shield Advanced might return the results in
--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.
[$sel:maxResults:ListProtectionGroups'] :: ListProtectionGroups -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListProtectionGroups</a> with all optional fields

--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to

--   this blank, Shield Advanced returns the first 20 results.

--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.

--   protection groups than the value of MaxResults, Shield Advanced
--   returns this token that you can use in your next request, to get the
--   next batch of objects.
[$sel:nextToken:ListProtectionGroupsResponse'] :: ListProtectionGroupsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.

[$sel:protectionGroups:ListProtectionGroupsResponse'] :: ListProtectionGroupsResponse -> [ProtectionGroup]

-- | Returns all ongoing DDoS attacks or all DDoS attacks during a
--   specified time period.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAttacks</a> smart constructor.
data ListAttacks
ListAttacks' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe TimeRange -> Maybe TimeRange -> Maybe [Text] -> ListAttacks

-- | The <tt>ListAttacksRequest.NextMarker</tt> value from a previous call
--   to <tt>ListAttacksRequest</tt>. Pass null if this is the first call.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAttacks'] :: ListAttacks -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of AttackSummary objects to return. If you leave
--   this blank, Shield Advanced returns the first 20 results.
--   
--   This is a maximum value. Shield Advanced might return the results in
--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.
[$sel:maxResults:ListAttacks'] :: ListAttacks -> Maybe Natural

-- | The start of the time period for the attacks. This is a
--   <tt>timestamp</tt> type. The sample request above indicates a
--   <tt>number</tt> type because the default used by WAF is Unix time in
--   seconds. However any valid <a>timestamp format</a> is allowed.
[$sel:startTime:ListAttacks'] :: ListAttacks -> Maybe TimeRange

-- | The end of the time period for the attacks. This is a
--   <tt>timestamp</tt> type. The sample request above indicates a
--   <tt>number</tt> type because the default used by WAF is Unix time in
--   seconds. However any valid <a>timestamp format</a> is allowed.
[$sel:endTime:ListAttacks'] :: ListAttacks -> Maybe TimeRange

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the resource that was attacked. If
--   this is left blank, all applicable resources for this account will be
--   included.
[$sel:resourceArns:ListAttacks'] :: ListAttacks -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAttacks</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAttacks'</a>, <a>listAttacks_nextToken</a> - The
--   <tt>ListAttacksRequest.NextMarker</tt> value from a previous call to
--   <tt>ListAttacksRequest</tt>. Pass null if this is the first call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListAttacks'</a>, <a>listAttacks_maxResults</a> -
--   The maximum number of AttackSummary objects to return. If you leave
--   this blank, Shield Advanced returns the first 20 results.
--   
--   This is a maximum value. Shield Advanced might return the results in
--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ListAttacks'</a>, <a>listAttacks_startTime</a> - The
--   start of the time period for the attacks. This is a <tt>timestamp</tt>
--   type. The sample request above indicates a <tt>number</tt> type
--   because the default used by WAF is Unix time in seconds. However any
--   valid <a>timestamp format</a> is allowed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:ListAttacks'</a>, <a>listAttacks_endTime</a> - The end
--   of the time period for the attacks. This is a <tt>timestamp</tt> type.
--   The sample request above indicates a <tt>number</tt> type because the
--   default used by WAF is Unix time in seconds. However any valid
--   <a>timestamp format</a> is allowed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArns:ListAttacks'</a>, <a>listAttacks_resourceArns</a>
--   - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the resource that was attacked. If
--   this is left blank, all applicable resources for this account will be
--   included.
newListAttacks :: ListAttacks

-- | The <tt>ListAttacksRequest.NextMarker</tt> value from a previous call
--   to <tt>ListAttacksRequest</tt>. Pass null if this is the first call.
listAttacks_nextToken :: Lens' ListAttacks (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of AttackSummary objects to return. If you leave
--   this blank, Shield Advanced returns the first 20 results.
--   
--   This is a maximum value. Shield Advanced might return the results in
--   smaller batches. That is, the number of objects returned could be less
--   than <tt>MaxResults</tt>, even if there are still more objects yet to
--   return. If there are more objects to return, Shield Advanced returns a
--   value in <tt>NextToken</tt> that you can use in your next request, to
--   get the next batch of objects.
listAttacks_maxResults :: Lens' ListAttacks (Maybe Natural)

-- | The start of the time period for the attacks. This is a
--   <tt>timestamp</tt> type. The sample request above indicates a
--   <tt>number</tt> type because the default used by WAF is Unix time in
--   seconds. However any valid <a>timestamp format</a> is allowed.
listAttacks_startTime :: Lens' ListAttacks (Maybe TimeRange)

-- | The end of the time period for the attacks. This is a
--   <tt>timestamp</tt> type. The sample request above indicates a
--   <tt>number</tt> type because the default used by WAF is Unix time in
--   seconds. However any valid <a>timestamp format</a> is allowed.
listAttacks_endTime :: Lens' ListAttacks (Maybe TimeRange)

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the resource that was attacked. If
--   this is left blank, all applicable resources for this account will be
--   included.
listAttacks_resourceArns :: Lens' ListAttacks (Maybe [Text])

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAttacksResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListAttacksResponse
ListAttacksResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [AttackSummary] -> Int -> ListAttacksResponse

-- | The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more
--   data available. If not null, more results are available. Pass this
--   value for the <tt>NextMarker</tt> parameter in a subsequent call to
--   <tt>ListAttacks</tt> to retrieve the next set of items.
--   
--   Shield Advanced might return the list of AttackSummary objects in
--   batches smaller than the number specified by MaxResults. If there are
--   more attack summary objects to return, Shield Advanced will always
--   also return a <tt>NextToken</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAttacksResponse'] :: ListAttacksResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The attack information for the specified time range.
[$sel:attackSummaries:ListAttacksResponse'] :: ListAttacksResponse -> Maybe [AttackSummary]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListAttacksResponse'] :: ListAttacksResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAttacksResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAttacks'</a>,
--   <a>listAttacksResponse_nextToken</a> - The token returned by a
--   previous call to indicate that there is more data available. If not
--   null, more results are available. Pass this value for the
--   <tt>NextMarker</tt> parameter in a subsequent call to
--   <tt>ListAttacks</tt> to retrieve the next set of items.
--   
--   Shield Advanced might return the list of AttackSummary objects in
--   batches smaller than the number specified by MaxResults. If there are
--   more attack summary objects to return, Shield Advanced will always
--   also return a <tt>NextToken</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackSummaries:ListAttacksResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAttacksResponse_attackSummaries</a> - The attack information
--   for the specified time range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListAttacksResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAttacksResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListAttacksResponse :: Int -> ListAttacksResponse

-- | The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more
--   data available. If not null, more results are available. Pass this
--   value for the <tt>NextMarker</tt> parameter in a subsequent call to
--   <tt>ListAttacks</tt> to retrieve the next set of items.
--   
--   Shield Advanced might return the list of AttackSummary objects in
--   batches smaller than the number specified by MaxResults. If there are
--   more attack summary objects to return, Shield Advanced will always
--   also return a <tt>NextToken</tt>.
listAttacksResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListAttacksResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The attack information for the specified time range.
listAttacksResponse_attackSummaries :: Lens' ListAttacksResponse (Maybe [AttackSummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listAttacksResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListAttacksResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacksResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacksResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacksResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacksResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacksResponse
instance Network.AWS.Pager.AWSPager Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Shield.ListAttacks.ListAttacks

-- | Returns the <tt>SubscriptionState</tt>, either <tt>Active</tt> or
--   <tt>Inactive</tt>.
module Network.AWS.Shield.GetSubscriptionState

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSubscriptionState</a> smart constructor.
data GetSubscriptionState
GetSubscriptionState' :: GetSubscriptionState

-- | Create a value of <a>GetSubscriptionState</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newGetSubscriptionState :: GetSubscriptionState

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSubscriptionStateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetSubscriptionStateResponse
GetSubscriptionStateResponse' :: Int -> SubscriptionState -> GetSubscriptionStateResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetSubscriptionStateResponse'] :: GetSubscriptionStateResponse -> Int

-- | The status of the subscription.
[$sel:subscriptionState:GetSubscriptionStateResponse'] :: GetSubscriptionStateResponse -> SubscriptionState

-- | Create a value of <a>GetSubscriptionStateResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetSubscriptionStateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getSubscriptionStateResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionState:GetSubscriptionStateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getSubscriptionStateResponse_subscriptionState</a> - The status of
--   the subscription.
newGetSubscriptionStateResponse :: Int -> SubscriptionState -> GetSubscriptionStateResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
getSubscriptionStateResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetSubscriptionStateResponse Int

-- | The status of the subscription.
getSubscriptionStateResponse_subscriptionState :: Lens' GetSubscriptionStateResponse SubscriptionState

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.GetSubscriptionState.GetSubscriptionState

-- | Authorizes the Shield Response Team (SRT) to use email and phone to
--   notify contacts about escalations to the SRT and to initiate proactive
--   customer support.
module Network.AWS.Shield.EnableProactiveEngagement

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableProactiveEngagement</a> smart constructor.
data EnableProactiveEngagement
EnableProactiveEngagement' :: EnableProactiveEngagement

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableProactiveEngagement</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newEnableProactiveEngagement :: EnableProactiveEngagement

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableProactiveEngagementResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data EnableProactiveEngagementResponse
EnableProactiveEngagementResponse' :: Int -> EnableProactiveEngagementResponse

-- | Removes health-based detection from the Shield Advanced protection for
--   a resource. Shield Advanced health-based detection uses the health of
--   your Amazon Web Services resource to improve responsiveness and
--   accuracy in attack detection and mitigation.
--   
--   You define the health check in Route 53 and then associate or
--   disassociate it with your Shield Advanced protection. For more
--   information, see <a>Shield Advanced Health-Based Detection</a> in the
--   <i>WAF Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Shield.DisassociateHealthCheck

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateHealthCheck</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateHealthCheck
DisassociateHealthCheck' :: Text -> Text -> DisassociateHealthCheck

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object to remove the
--   health check association from.
[$sel:protectionId:DisassociateHealthCheck'] :: DisassociateHealthCheck -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the health check that is associated
--   with the protection.
[$sel:healthCheckArn:DisassociateHealthCheck'] :: DisassociateHealthCheck -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateHealthCheck</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionId:DisassociateHealthCheck'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateHealthCheck_protectionId</a> - The unique identifier
--   (ID) for the Protection object to remove the health check association
--   from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheckArn:DisassociateHealthCheck'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateHealthCheck_healthCheckArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the health check that is associated with the protection.
newDisassociateHealthCheck :: Text -> Text -> DisassociateHealthCheck

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object to remove the
--   health check association from.
disassociateHealthCheck_protectionId :: Lens' DisassociateHealthCheck Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the health check that is associated
--   with the protection.
disassociateHealthCheck_healthCheckArn :: Lens' DisassociateHealthCheck Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateHealthCheckResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DisassociateHealthCheckResponse
DisassociateHealthCheckResponse' :: Int -> DisassociateHealthCheckResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DisassociateHealthCheckResponse'] :: DisassociateHealthCheckResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateHealthCheckResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DisassociateHealthCheckResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateHealthCheckResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newDisassociateHealthCheckResponse :: Int -> DisassociateHealthCheckResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
disassociateHealthCheckResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DisassociateHealthCheckResponse Int

-- | Removes the Shield Response Team's (SRT) access to your Amazon Web
--   Services account.
--   
--   To make a <tt>DisassociateDRTRole</tt> request, you must be subscribed
--   to the <a>Business Support plan</a> or the <a>Enterprise Support
--   plan</a>. However, if you are not subscribed to one of these support
--   plans, but had been previously and had granted the SRT access to your
--   account, you can submit a <tt>DisassociateDRTRole</tt> request to
--   remove this access.
module Network.AWS.Shield.DisassociateDRTRole

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateDRTRole</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateDRTRole
DisassociateDRTRole' :: DisassociateDRTRole

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateDRTRole</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDisassociateDRTRole :: DisassociateDRTRole

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateDRTRoleResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateDRTRoleResponse
DisassociateDRTRoleResponse' :: Int -> DisassociateDRTRoleResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DisassociateDRTRoleResponse'] :: DisassociateDRTRoleResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateDRTRoleResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DisassociateDRTRoleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateDRTRoleResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDisassociateDRTRoleResponse :: Int -> DisassociateDRTRoleResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
disassociateDRTRoleResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DisassociateDRTRoleResponse Int

-- | Removes the Shield Response Team's (SRT) access to the specified
--   Amazon S3 bucket containing the logs that you shared previously.
--   
--   To make a <tt>DisassociateDRTLogBucket</tt> request, you must be
--   subscribed to the <a>Business Support plan</a> or the <a>Enterprise
--   Support plan</a>. However, if you are not subscribed to one of these
--   support plans, but had been previously and had granted the SRT access
--   to your account, you can submit a <tt>DisassociateDRTLogBucket</tt>
--   request to remove this access.

--   fields omitted.

--   contains the logs that you want to share.

-- | Returns the specification for the specified protection group.

--   protection group in lists and to manage the protection group, for
--   example to update, delete, or describe it.
[$sel:protectionGroupId:DescribeProtectionGroup'] :: DescribeProtectionGroup -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeProtectionGroup</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   lists and to manage the protection group, for example to update,
--   delete, or describe it.

--   protection group in lists and to manage the protection group, for
--   example to update, delete, or describe it.
describeProtectionGroup_protectionGroupId :: Lens' DescribeProtectionGroup Text

--   constructor.
data DescribeProtectionGroupResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeProtectionGroupResponse'] :: DescribeProtectionGroupResponse -> Int

-- | A grouping of protected resources that you and Shield Advanced can
--   monitor as a collective. This resource grouping improves the accuracy
--   of detection and reduces false positives.
[$sel:protectionGroup:DescribeProtectionGroupResponse'] :: DescribeProtectionGroupResponse -> ProtectionGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeProtectionGroupResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionGroup:DescribeProtectionGroupResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeProtectionGroupResponse_protectionGroup</a> - A grouping of
--   protected resources that you and Shield Advanced can monitor as a
--   collective. This resource grouping improves the accuracy of detection
--   and reduces false positives.
newDescribeProtectionGroupResponse :: Int -> ProtectionGroup -> DescribeProtectionGroupResponse

-- | A grouping of protected resources that you and Shield Advanced can
--   monitor as a collective. This resource grouping improves the accuracy
--   of detection and reduces false positives.

-- | Lists the details of a Protection object.
module Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeProtection

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeProtection</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeProtection
DescribeProtection' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DescribeProtection

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Amazon Web Services resource for
--   the Protection object that is described. When submitting the
--   <tt>DescribeProtection</tt> request you must provide either the
--   <tt>ResourceArn</tt> or the <tt>ProtectionID</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:resourceArn:DescribeProtection'] :: DescribeProtection -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object that is
--   described. When submitting the <tt>DescribeProtection</tt> request you
--   must provide either the <tt>ResourceArn</tt> or the
--   <tt>ProtectionID</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:protectionId:DescribeProtection'] :: DescribeProtection -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeProtection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:DescribeProtection'</a>,
--   <a>describeProtection_resourceArn</a> - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name)
--   of the Amazon Web Services resource for the Protection object that is
--   described. When submitting the <tt>DescribeProtection</tt> request you
--   must provide either the <tt>ResourceArn</tt> or the
--   <tt>ProtectionID</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionId:DescribeProtection'</a>,
--   <a>describeProtection_protectionId</a> - The unique identifier (ID)
--   for the Protection object that is described. When submitting the
--   <tt>DescribeProtection</tt> request you must provide either the
--   <tt>ResourceArn</tt> or the <tt>ProtectionID</tt>, but not both.
newDescribeProtection :: DescribeProtection

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Amazon Web Services resource for
--   the Protection object that is described. When submitting the
--   <tt>DescribeProtection</tt> request you must provide either the
--   <tt>ResourceArn</tt> or the <tt>ProtectionID</tt>, but not both.
describeProtection_resourceArn :: Lens' DescribeProtection (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object that is
--   described. When submitting the <tt>DescribeProtection</tt> request you
--   must provide either the <tt>ResourceArn</tt> or the
--   <tt>ProtectionID</tt>, but not both.
describeProtection_protectionId :: Lens' DescribeProtection (Maybe Text)

--   <a>describeProtectionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http

-- | A list of email addresses and phone numbers that the Shield Response
--   Team (SRT) can use to contact you if you have proactive engagement
--   enabled, for escalations to the SRT and to initiate proactive customer
--   support.
module Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeEmergencyContactSettings

--   constructor.

-- | Returns the current role and list of Amazon S3 log buckets used by the
--   Shield Response Team (SRT) to access your Amazon Web Services account
--   while assisting with attack mitigation.
module Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeDRTAccess

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDRTAccess</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDRTAccess

--   fields.

-- | Provides information about the number and type of attacks Shield has
--   detected in the last year for all resources that belong to your
--   account, regardless of whether you've defined Shield protections for
--   them. This operation is available to Shield customers as well as to
--   Shield Advanced customers.
--   
--   The operation returns data for the time range of midnight UTC, one
--   year ago, to midnight UTC, today. For example, if the current time is
--   <tt>2020-10-26 15:39:32 PDT</tt>, equal to <tt>2020-10-26 22:39:32
--   UTC</tt>, then the time range for the attack data returned is from
--   <tt>2019-10-26 00:00:00 UTC</tt> to <tt>2020-10-26 00:00:00 UTC</tt>.
--   
--   The time range indicates the period covered by the attack statistics
--   data items.
module Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAttackStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeAttackStatistics
DescribeAttackStatistics' :: DescribeAttackStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAttackStatistics</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDescribeAttackStatistics :: DescribeAttackStatistics

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAttackStatisticsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse
DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse' :: Int -> TimeRange -> [AttackStatisticsDataItem] -> DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse'] :: DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse -> Int
[$sel:timeRange:DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse'] :: DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse -> TimeRange

-- | The data that describes the attacks detected during the time period.
[$sel:dataItems:DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse'] :: DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse -> [AttackStatisticsDataItem]

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAttackStatisticsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeRange:DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAttackStatisticsResponse_timeRange</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataItems:DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAttackStatisticsResponse_dataItems</a> - The data that
--   describes the attacks detected during the time period.
newDescribeAttackStatisticsResponse :: Int -> TimeRange -> DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
describeAttackStatisticsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse Int

-- | Undocumented member.
describeAttackStatisticsResponse_timeRange :: Lens' DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse TimeRange

-- | The data that describes the attacks detected during the time period.
describeAttackStatisticsResponse_dataItems :: Lens' DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse [AttackStatisticsDataItem]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatisticsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Shield.DescribeAttackStatistics.DescribeAttackStatistics


-- | Describes the details of a DDoS attack.

--   omitted.

--   delete, or describe it.

-- | Deletes an Shield Advanced Protection.
module Network.AWS.Shield.DeleteProtection

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteProtection</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteProtection
DeleteProtection' :: Text -> DeleteProtection

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object to be deleted.
[$sel:protectionId:DeleteProtection'] :: DeleteProtection -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteProtection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionId:DeleteProtection'</a>,
--   <a>deleteProtection_protectionId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) for
--   the Protection object to be deleted.

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object to be deleted.

-- | Activates Shield Advanced for an account.
--   
--   When you initally create a subscription, your subscription is set to
--   be automatically renewed at the end of the existing subscription
--   period. You can change this by submitting an
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request.
module Network.AWS.Shield.CreateSubscription

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateSubscription</a> smart constructor.

-- | Creates a grouping of protected resources so they can be handled as a
--   collective. This resource grouping improves the accuracy of detection
--   and reduces false positives.
module Network.AWS.Shield.CreateProtectionGroup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateProtectionGroup</a> smart constructor.
data CreateProtectionGroup
CreateProtectionGroup' :: Maybe ProtectedResourceType -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> ProtectionGroupAggregation -> ProtectionGroupPattern -> CreateProtectionGroup

-- | The resource type to include in the protection group. All protected
--   resources of this type are included in the protection group. Newly
--   protected resources of this type are automatically added to the group.
--   You must set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to
--   <tt>BY_RESOURCE_TYPE</tt> and you must not set it for any other
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
[$sel:resourceType:CreateProtectionGroup'] :: CreateProtectionGroup -> Maybe ProtectedResourceType

-- | One or more tag key-value pairs for the protection group.
[$sel:tags:CreateProtectionGroup'] :: CreateProtectionGroup -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the resources to include in the
--   protection group. You must set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to
--   <tt>ARBITRARY</tt> and you must not set it for any other
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
[$sel:members:CreateProtectionGroup'] :: CreateProtectionGroup -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the protection group. You use this to identify the
--   protection group in lists and to manage the protection group, for
--   example to update, delete, or describe it.
[$sel:protectionGroupId:CreateProtectionGroup'] :: CreateProtectionGroup -> Text

-- | Defines how Shield combines resource data for the group in order to
--   detect, mitigate, and report events.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Sum - Use the total traffic across the group. This is a good
--   choice for most cases. Examples include Elastic IP addresses for EC2
--   instances that scale manually or automatically.</li>
--   <li>Mean - Use the average of the traffic across the group. This is a
--   good choice for resources that share traffic uniformly. Examples
--   include accelerators and load balancers.</li>
--   <li>Max - Use the highest traffic from each resource. This is useful
--   for resources that don't share traffic and for resources that share
--   that traffic in a non-uniform way. Examples include Amazon CloudFront
--   and origin resources for CloudFront distributions.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:aggregation:CreateProtectionGroup'] :: CreateProtectionGroup -> ProtectionGroupAggregation

-- | The criteria to use to choose the protected resources for inclusion in
--   the group. You can include all resources that have protections,
--   provide a list of resource Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), or include
--   all resources of a specified resource type.
[$sel:pattern':CreateProtectionGroup'] :: CreateProtectionGroup -> ProtectionGroupPattern

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateProtectionGroup</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:CreateProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>createProtectionGroup_resourceType</a> - The resource type to
--   include in the protection group. All protected resources of this type
--   are included in the protection group. Newly protected resources of
--   this type are automatically added to the group. You must set this when
--   you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to <tt>BY_RESOURCE_TYPE</tt> and you must not
--   set it for any other <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>createProtectionGroup_tags</a> - One or more tag key-value pairs
--   for the protection group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:members:CreateProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>createProtectionGroup_members</a> - The Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs) of the resources to include in the protection group. You must
--   set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to <tt>ARBITRARY</tt> and you
--   must not set it for any other <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionGroupId:CreateProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>createProtectionGroup_protectionGroupId</a> - The name of the
--   protection group. You use this to identify the protection group in
--   lists and to manage the protection group, for example to update,
--   delete, or describe it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aggregation:CreateProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>createProtectionGroup_aggregation</a> - Defines how Shield combines
--   resource data for the group in order to detect, mitigate, and report
--   events.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Sum - Use the total traffic across the group. This is a good
--   choice for most cases. Examples include Elastic IP addresses for EC2
--   instances that scale manually or automatically.</li>
--   <li>Mean - Use the average of the traffic across the group. This is a
--   good choice for resources that share traffic uniformly. Examples
--   include accelerators and load balancers.</li>
--   <li>Max - Use the highest traffic from each resource. This is useful
--   for resources that don't share traffic and for resources that share
--   that traffic in a non-uniform way. Examples include Amazon CloudFront
--   and origin resources for CloudFront distributions.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:pattern':CreateProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>createProtectionGroup_pattern</a> - The criteria to use to choose
--   the protected resources for inclusion in the group. You can include
--   all resources that have protections, provide a list of resource Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs), or include all resources of a specified
--   resource type.
newCreateProtectionGroup :: Text -> ProtectionGroupAggregation -> ProtectionGroupPattern -> CreateProtectionGroup

-- | The resource type to include in the protection group. All protected
--   resources of this type are included in the protection group. Newly
--   protected resources of this type are automatically added to the group.
--   You must set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to
--   <tt>BY_RESOURCE_TYPE</tt> and you must not set it for any other
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
createProtectionGroup_resourceType :: Lens' CreateProtectionGroup (Maybe ProtectedResourceType)

-- | One or more tag key-value pairs for the protection group.
createProtectionGroup_tags :: Lens' CreateProtectionGroup (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the resources to include in the
--   protection group. You must set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to
--   <tt>ARBITRARY</tt> and you must not set it for any other
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
createProtectionGroup_members :: Lens' CreateProtectionGroup (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the protection group. You use this to identify the
--   protection group in lists and to manage the protection group, for
--   example to update, delete, or describe it.
createProtectionGroup_protectionGroupId :: Lens' CreateProtectionGroup Text

-- | Defines how Shield combines resource data for the group in order to
--   detect, mitigate, and report events.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Sum - Use the total traffic across the group. This is a good
--   choice for most cases. Examples include Elastic IP addresses for EC2
--   instances that scale manually or automatically.</li>
--   <li>Mean - Use the average of the traffic across the group. This is a
--   good choice for resources that share traffic uniformly. Examples
--   include accelerators and load balancers.</li>
--   <li>Max - Use the highest traffic from each resource. This is useful
--   for resources that don't share traffic and for resources that share
--   that traffic in a non-uniform way. Examples include Amazon CloudFront
--   and origin resources for CloudFront distributions.</li>
--   </ul>
createProtectionGroup_aggregation :: Lens' CreateProtectionGroup ProtectionGroupAggregation

-- | The criteria to use to choose the protected resources for inclusion in
--   the group. You can include all resources that have protections,
--   provide a list of resource Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), or include
--   all resources of a specified resource type.
createProtectionGroup_pattern :: Lens' CreateProtectionGroup ProtectionGroupPattern

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateProtectionGroupResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateProtectionGroupResponse
CreateProtectionGroupResponse' :: Int -> CreateProtectionGroupResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateProtectionGroupResponse'] :: CreateProtectionGroupResponse -> Int

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateProtectionGroupResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createProtectionGroupResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCreateProtectionGroupResponse :: Int -> CreateProtectionGroupResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
createProtectionGroupResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateProtectionGroupResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Shield.CreateProtectionGroup.CreateProtectionGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Shield.CreateProtectionGroup.CreateProtectionGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Shield.CreateProtectionGroup.CreateProtectionGroup
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Shield.CreateProtectionGroup.CreateProtectionGroupResponse

-- | Enables Shield Advanced for a specific Amazon Web Services resource.
--   The resource can be an Amazon CloudFront distribution, Elastic Load
--   Balancing load balancer, Global Accelerator accelerator, Elastic IP
--   Address, or an Amazon Route 53 hosted zone.
--   
--   You can add protection to only a single resource with each
--   CreateProtection request. If you want to add protection to multiple
--   resources at once, use the <a>WAF console</a>. For more information
--   see <a>Getting Started with Shield Advanced</a> and <a>Add Shield
--   Advanced Protection to more Amazon Web Services Resources</a>.
module Network.AWS.Shield.CreateProtection

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateProtection</a> smart constructor.
data CreateProtection
CreateProtection' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateProtection

-- | One or more tag key-value pairs for the Protection object that is
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateProtection'] :: CreateProtection -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Friendly name for the <tt>Protection</tt> you are creating.
[$sel:name:CreateProtection'] :: CreateProtection -> Text

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the resource to be protected.
--   
--   The ARN should be in one of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For an Application Load Balancer:
--   <tt>arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:region:account-id:loadbalancer/app/load-balancer-name/load-balancer-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Elastic Load Balancer (Classic Load Balancer):
--   <tt>arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:region:account-id:loadbalancer/load-balancer-name
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Amazon CloudFront distribution:
--   <tt>arn:aws:cloudfront::account-id:distribution/distribution-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Global Accelerator accelerator:
--   <tt>arn:aws:globalaccelerator::account-id:accelerator/accelerator-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For Amazon Route 53:
--   <tt>arn:aws:route53:::hostedzone/hosted-zone-id </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Elastic IP address:
--   <tt>arn:aws:ec2:region:account-id:eip-allocation/allocation-id
--   </tt></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:resourceArn:CreateProtection'] :: CreateProtection -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateProtection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateProtection'</a>, <a>createProtection_tags</a> - One
--   or more tag key-value pairs for the Protection object that is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateProtection'</a>, <a>createProtection_name</a> -
--   Friendly name for the <tt>Protection</tt> you are creating.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:CreateProtection'</a>,
--   <a>createProtection_resourceArn</a> - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name)
--   of the resource to be protected.
--   
--   The ARN should be in one of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For an Application Load Balancer:
--   <tt>arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:region:account-id:loadbalancer/app/load-balancer-name/load-balancer-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Elastic Load Balancer (Classic Load Balancer):
--   <tt>arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:region:account-id:loadbalancer/load-balancer-name
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Amazon CloudFront distribution:
--   <tt>arn:aws:cloudfront::account-id:distribution/distribution-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Global Accelerator accelerator:
--   <tt>arn:aws:globalaccelerator::account-id:accelerator/accelerator-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For Amazon Route 53:
--   <tt>arn:aws:route53:::hostedzone/hosted-zone-id </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Elastic IP address:
--   <tt>arn:aws:ec2:region:account-id:eip-allocation/allocation-id
--   </tt></li>
--   </ul>
newCreateProtection :: Text -> Text -> CreateProtection

-- | One or more tag key-value pairs for the Protection object that is
--   created.
createProtection_tags :: Lens' CreateProtection (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Friendly name for the <tt>Protection</tt> you are creating.
createProtection_name :: Lens' CreateProtection Text

-- | The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the resource to be protected.
--   
--   The ARN should be in one of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For an Application Load Balancer:
--   <tt>arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:region:account-id:loadbalancer/app/load-balancer-name/load-balancer-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Elastic Load Balancer (Classic Load Balancer):
--   <tt>arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:region:account-id:loadbalancer/load-balancer-name
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Amazon CloudFront distribution:
--   <tt>arn:aws:cloudfront::account-id:distribution/distribution-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Global Accelerator accelerator:
--   <tt>arn:aws:globalaccelerator::account-id:accelerator/accelerator-id
--   </tt></li>
--   <li>For Amazon Route 53:
--   <tt>arn:aws:route53:::hostedzone/hosted-zone-id </tt></li>
--   <li>For an Elastic IP address:
--   <tt>arn:aws:ec2:region:account-id:eip-allocation/allocation-id
--   </tt></li>
--   </ul>
createProtection_resourceArn :: Lens' CreateProtection Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateProtectionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateProtectionResponse
CreateProtectionResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateProtectionResponse

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object that is created.
[$sel:protectionId:CreateProtectionResponse'] :: CreateProtectionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Initializes proactive engagement and sets the list of contacts for the
--   Shield Response Team (SRT) to use. You must provide at least one phone
--   number in the emergency contact list.
--   
--   After you have initialized proactive engagement using this call, to
--   disable or enable proactive engagement, use the calls
--   <tt>DisableProactiveEngagement</tt> and
--   <tt>EnableProactiveEngagement</tt>.
--   
--   This call defines the list of email addresses and phone numbers that
--   the SRT can use to contact you for escalations to the SRT and to
--   initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   The contacts that you provide in the request replace any contacts that
--   were already defined. If you already have contacts defined and want to
--   use them, retrieve the list using
--   <tt>DescribeEmergencyContactSettings</tt> and then provide it to this
--   call.
module Network.AWS.Shield.AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateProactiveEngagementDetails</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails
AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails' :: [EmergencyContact] -> AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails

-- | A list of email addresses and phone numbers that the Shield Response
--   Team (SRT) can use to contact you for escalations to the SRT and to
--   initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   To enable proactive engagement, the contact list must include at least
--   one phone number.
--   
--   The contacts that you provide here replace any contacts that were
--   already defined. If you already have contacts defined and want to use
--   them, retrieve the list using
--   <tt>DescribeEmergencyContactSettings</tt> and then provide it here.
[$sel:emergencyContactList:AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails'] :: AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails -> [EmergencyContact]

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:emergencyContactList:AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails'</a>,
--   <a>associateProactiveEngagementDetails_emergencyContactList</a> - A
--   list of email addresses and phone numbers that the Shield Response
--   Team (SRT) can use to contact you for escalations to the SRT and to
--   initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   To enable proactive engagement, the contact list must include at least
--   one phone number.
--   
--   The contacts that you provide here replace any contacts that were
--   already defined. If you already have contacts defined and want to use
--   them, retrieve the list using
--   <tt>DescribeEmergencyContactSettings</tt> and then provide it here.
newAssociateProactiveEngagementDetails :: AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails

-- | A list of email addresses and phone numbers that the Shield Response
--   Team (SRT) can use to contact you for escalations to the SRT and to
--   initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   To enable proactive engagement, the contact list must include at least
--   one phone number.
--   
--   The contacts that you provide here replace any contacts that were
--   already defined. If you already have contacts defined and want to use
--   them, retrieve the list using
--   <tt>DescribeEmergencyContactSettings</tt> and then provide it here.
associateProactiveEngagementDetails_emergencyContactList :: Lens' AssociateProactiveEngagementDetails [EmergencyContact]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse
AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse' :: Int -> AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse'] :: AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>associateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newAssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse :: Int -> AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
associateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AssociateProactiveEngagementDetailsResponse Int

-- | Adds health-based detection to the Shield Advanced protection for a
--   resource. Shield Advanced health-based detection uses the health of
--   your Amazon Web Services resource to improve responsiveness and
--   accuracy in attack detection and mitigation.
--   
--   You define the health check in Route 53 and then associate it with
--   your Shield Advanced protection. For more information, see <a>Shield
--   Advanced Health-Based Detection</a> in the <i>WAF Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Shield.AssociateHealthCheck

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateHealthCheck</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateHealthCheck
AssociateHealthCheck' :: Text -> Text -> AssociateHealthCheck

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object to add the health
--   check association to.
[$sel:protectionId:AssociateHealthCheck'] :: AssociateHealthCheck -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the health check to associate with
--   the protection.
[$sel:healthCheckArn:AssociateHealthCheck'] :: AssociateHealthCheck -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateHealthCheck</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionId:AssociateHealthCheck'</a>,
--   <a>associateHealthCheck_protectionId</a> - The unique identifier (ID)
--   for the Protection object to add the health check association to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheckArn:AssociateHealthCheck'</a>,
--   <a>associateHealthCheck_healthCheckArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the health check to associate with the protection.
newAssociateHealthCheck :: Text -> Text -> AssociateHealthCheck

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the Protection object to add the health
--   check association to.
associateHealthCheck_protectionId :: Lens' AssociateHealthCheck Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the health check to associate with
--   the protection.
associateHealthCheck_healthCheckArn :: Lens' AssociateHealthCheck Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateHealthCheckResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateHealthCheckResponse
AssociateHealthCheckResponse' :: Int -> AssociateHealthCheckResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AssociateHealthCheckResponse'] :: AssociateHealthCheckResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateHealthCheckResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AssociateHealthCheckResponse'</a>,
--   <a>associateHealthCheckResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newAssociateHealthCheckResponse :: Int -> AssociateHealthCheckResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
associateHealthCheckResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AssociateHealthCheckResponse Int

-- | Authorizes the Shield Response Team (SRT) using the specified role, to
--   access your Amazon Web Services account to assist with DDoS attack
--   mitigation during potential attacks. This enables the SRT to inspect
--   your WAF configuration and create or update WAF rules and web ACLs.
--   
--   You can associate only one <tt>RoleArn</tt> with your subscription. If
--   you submit an <tt>AssociateDRTRole</tt> request for an account that
--   already has an associated role, the new <tt>RoleArn</tt> will replace
--   the existing <tt>RoleArn</tt>.
--   
--   Prior to making the <tt>AssociateDRTRole</tt> request, you must attach
--   the <a>AWSShieldDRTAccessPolicy</a> managed policy to the role you
--   will specify in the request. For more information see <a>Attaching and
--   Detaching IAM Policies</a>. The role must also trust the service
--   principal <tt> drt.shield.amazonaws.com</tt>. For more information,
--   see <a>IAM JSON Policy Elements: Principal</a>.
--   
--   The SRT will have access only to your WAF and Shield resources. By
--   submitting this request, you authorize the SRT to inspect your WAF and
--   Shield configuration and create and update WAF rules and web ACLs on
--   your behalf. The SRT takes these actions only if explicitly authorized
--   by you.
--   
--   You must have the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> permission to make an
--   <tt>AssociateDRTRole</tt> request. For more information, see
--   <a>Granting a User Permissions to Pass a Role to an Amazon Web
--   Services Service</a>.
--   
--   To use the services of the SRT and make an <tt>AssociateDRTRole</tt>
--   request, you must be subscribed to the <a>Business Support plan</a> or
--   the <a>Enterprise Support plan</a>.
module Network.AWS.Shield.AssociateDRTRole

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateDRTRole</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateDRTRole
AssociateDRTRole' :: Text -> AssociateDRTRole

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role the SRT will use to access
--   your Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   Prior to making the <tt>AssociateDRTRole</tt> request, you must attach
--   the <a>AWSShieldDRTAccessPolicy</a> managed policy to this role. For
--   more information see <a>Attaching and Detaching IAM Policies</a>.
[$sel:roleArn:AssociateDRTRole'] :: AssociateDRTRole -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateDRTRole</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:AssociateDRTRole'</a>, <a>associateDRTRole_roleArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role the SRT will use to
--   access your Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   Prior to making the <tt>AssociateDRTRole</tt> request, you must attach
--   the <a>AWSShieldDRTAccessPolicy</a> managed policy to this role. For
--   more information see <a>Attaching and Detaching IAM Policies</a>.
newAssociateDRTRole :: Text -> AssociateDRTRole

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role the SRT will use to access
--   your Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   Prior to making the <tt>AssociateDRTRole</tt> request, you must attach
--   the <a>AWSShieldDRTAccessPolicy</a> managed policy to this role. For
--   more information see <a>Attaching and Detaching IAM Policies</a>.
associateDRTRole_roleArn :: Lens' AssociateDRTRole Text

-- | Removes tags from a resource in Shield.
module Network.AWS.Shield.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to remove
--   tags from.
[$sel:resourceARN:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The tag key for each tag that you want to remove from the resource.
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceARN:UntagResource'</a>,
--   <a>untagResource_resourceARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the resource that you want to remove tags from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   tag key for each tag that you want to remove from the resource.
newUntagResource :: Text -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to remove
--   tags from.
untagResource_resourceARN :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The tag key for each tag that you want to remove from the resource.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | Updates the details of the list of email addresses and phone numbers
--   that the Shield Response Team (SRT) can use to contact you if you have
--   proactive engagement enabled, for escalations to the SRT and to
--   initiate proactive customer support.
module Network.AWS.Shield.UpdateEmergencyContactSettings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateEmergencyContactSettings</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateEmergencyContactSettings
UpdateEmergencyContactSettings' :: Maybe [EmergencyContact] -> UpdateEmergencyContactSettings

-- | A list of email addresses and phone numbers that the Shield Response
--   Team (SRT) can use to contact you if you have proactive engagement
--   enabled, for escalations to the SRT and to initiate proactive customer
--   support.
--   
--   If you have proactive engagement enabled, the contact list must
--   include at least one phone number.
[$sel:emergencyContactList:UpdateEmergencyContactSettings'] :: UpdateEmergencyContactSettings -> Maybe [EmergencyContact]

--   optional fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>updateEmergencyContactSettings_emergencyContactList</a> - A list of
--   email addresses and phone numbers that the Shield Response Team (SRT)
--   can use to contact you if you have proactive engagement enabled, for
--   escalations to the SRT and to initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   If you have proactive engagement enabled, the contact list must
--   include at least one phone number.
newUpdateEmergencyContactSettings :: UpdateEmergencyContactSettings

-- | A list of email addresses and phone numbers that the Shield Response
--   Team (SRT) can use to contact you if you have proactive engagement
--   enabled, for escalations to the SRT and to initiate proactive customer
--   support.
--   
--   If you have proactive engagement enabled, the contact list must
--   include at least one phone number.
