newtype AttackLayer
AttackLayer' :: Text -> AttackLayer
[fromAttackLayer] :: AttackLayer -> Text
pattern AttackLayer_APPLICATION :: AttackLayer
pattern AttackLayer_NETWORK :: AttackLayer
newtype AttackPropertyIdentifier
AttackPropertyIdentifier' :: Text -> AttackPropertyIdentifier
[fromAttackPropertyIdentifier] :: AttackPropertyIdentifier -> Text
pattern AttackPropertyIdentifier_DESTINATION_URL :: AttackPropertyIdentifier
pattern AttackPropertyIdentifier_REFERRER :: AttackPropertyIdentifier
pattern AttackPropertyIdentifier_SOURCE_ASN :: AttackPropertyIdentifier
pattern AttackPropertyIdentifier_SOURCE_COUNTRY :: AttackPropertyIdentifier
pattern AttackPropertyIdentifier_SOURCE_IP_ADDRESS :: AttackPropertyIdentifier
pattern AttackPropertyIdentifier_SOURCE_USER_AGENT :: AttackPropertyIdentifier
pattern AttackPropertyIdentifier_WORDPRESS_PINGBACK_REFLECTOR :: AttackPropertyIdentifier
pattern AttackPropertyIdentifier_WORDPRESS_PINGBACK_SOURCE :: AttackPropertyIdentifier
newtype AutoRenew
AutoRenew' :: Text -> AutoRenew
[fromAutoRenew] :: AutoRenew -> Text
pattern AutoRenew_DISABLED :: AutoRenew
pattern AutoRenew_ENABLED :: AutoRenew
newtype ProactiveEngagementStatus
ProactiveEngagementStatus' :: Text -> ProactiveEngagementStatus
[fromProactiveEngagementStatus] :: ProactiveEngagementStatus -> Text
pattern ProactiveEngagementStatus_DISABLED :: ProactiveEngagementStatus
pattern ProactiveEngagementStatus_ENABLED :: ProactiveEngagementStatus
pattern ProactiveEngagementStatus_PENDING :: ProactiveEngagementStatus
newtype ProtectedResourceType
ProtectedResourceType' :: Text -> ProtectedResourceType
[fromProtectedResourceType] :: ProtectedResourceType -> Text
pattern ProtectedResourceType_APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER :: ProtectedResourceType
pattern ProtectedResourceType_CLASSIC_LOAD_BALANCER :: ProtectedResourceType
pattern ProtectedResourceType_CLOUDFRONT_DISTRIBUTION :: ProtectedResourceType
pattern ProtectedResourceType_ELASTIC_IP_ALLOCATION :: ProtectedResourceType
pattern ProtectedResourceType_GLOBAL_ACCELERATOR :: ProtectedResourceType
pattern ProtectedResourceType_ROUTE_53_HOSTED_ZONE :: ProtectedResourceType
newtype ProtectionGroupAggregation
ProtectionGroupAggregation' :: Text -> ProtectionGroupAggregation
[fromProtectionGroupAggregation] :: ProtectionGroupAggregation -> Text
pattern ProtectionGroupAggregation_MAX :: ProtectionGroupAggregation
pattern ProtectionGroupAggregation_MEAN :: ProtectionGroupAggregation
pattern ProtectionGroupAggregation_SUM :: ProtectionGroupAggregation
newtype ProtectionGroupPattern
ProtectionGroupPattern' :: Text -> ProtectionGroupPattern
[fromProtectionGroupPattern] :: ProtectionGroupPattern -> Text
pattern ProtectionGroupPattern_ALL :: ProtectionGroupPattern
pattern ProtectionGroupPattern_ARBITRARY :: ProtectionGroupPattern
pattern ProtectionGroupPattern_BY_RESOURCE_TYPE :: ProtectionGroupPattern
newtype SubResourceType
SubResourceType' :: Text -> SubResourceType
[fromSubResourceType] :: SubResourceType -> Text
pattern SubResourceType_IP :: SubResourceType
pattern SubResourceType_URL :: SubResourceType
newtype SubscriptionState
SubscriptionState' :: Text -> SubscriptionState
[fromSubscriptionState] :: SubscriptionState -> Text
pattern SubscriptionState_ACTIVE :: SubscriptionState
pattern SubscriptionState_INACTIVE :: SubscriptionState
newtype Unit
Unit' :: Text -> Unit
[fromUnit] :: Unit -> Text
pattern Unit_BITS :: Unit
pattern Unit_BYTES :: Unit
pattern Unit_PACKETS :: Unit
pattern Unit_REQUESTS :: Unit

-- | The details of a DDoS attack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackDetail</a> smart constructor.
data AttackDetail
AttackDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [AttackProperty] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [SummarizedCounter] -> Maybe [Mitigation] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [SubResourceSummary] -> AttackDetail

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:AttackDetail'</a>, <a>attackDetail_resourceArn</a>
--   - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the resource that was attacked.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackProperties:AttackDetail'</a>,
--   <a>attackDetail_attackProperties</a> - The array of objects that
--   provide details of the Shield event.
--   
--   For infrastructure layer events (L3 and L4 events) after January 25,
--   2021, you can view metrics for top contributors in Amazon CloudWatch
--   metrics. For more information, see <a>Shield metrics and alarms</a> in
--   the <i>WAF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:AttackDetail'</a>, <a>attackDetail_startTime</a> -
--   The time the attack started, in Unix time in seconds. For more
--   information see <a>timestamp</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:AttackDetail'</a>, <a>attackDetail_endTime</a> - The
--   time the attack ended, in Unix time in seconds. For more information
--   see <a>timestamp</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackCounters:AttackDetail'</a>,
--   <a>attackDetail_attackCounters</a> - List of counters that describe
--   the attack for the specified time period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mitigations:AttackDetail'</a>, <a>attackDetail_mitigations</a>
--   - List of mitigation actions taken for the attack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackId:AttackDetail'</a>, <a>attackDetail_attackId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the attack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subResources:AttackDetail'</a>,
--   <a>attackDetail_subResources</a> - If applicable, additional detail
--   about the resource being attacked, for example, IP address or URL.
newAttackDetail :: AttackDetail

-- | Details of a Shield event. This is provided as part of an
--   AttackDetail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackProperty</a> smart constructor.
data AttackProperty
AttackProperty' :: Maybe Unit -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe AttackPropertyIdentifier -> Maybe [Contributor] -> Maybe AttackLayer -> AttackProperty

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackProperty</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:AttackProperty'</a>, <a>attackProperty_unit</a> - The
--   unit used for the <tt>Contributor</tt> <tt>Value</tt> property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:AttackProperty'</a>, <a>attackProperty_total</a> - The
--   total contributions made to this Shield event by all contributors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackPropertyIdentifier:AttackProperty'</a>,
--   <a>attackProperty_attackPropertyIdentifier</a> - Defines the Shield
--   event property information that is provided. The
--   <tt>WORDPRESS_PINGBACK_REFLECTOR</tt> and
--   <tt>WORDPRESS_PINGBACK_SOURCE</tt> values are valid only for WordPress
--   reflective pingback events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topContributors:AttackProperty'</a>,
--   <a>attackProperty_topContributors</a> - Contributor objects for the
--   top five contributors to a Shield event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackLayer:AttackProperty'</a>,
--   <a>attackProperty_attackLayer</a> - The type of Shield event that was
--   observed. <tt>NETWORK</tt> indicates layer 3 and layer 4 events and
--   <tt>APPLICATION</tt> indicates layer 7 events.
--   
--   For infrastructure layer events (L3 and L4 events) after January 25,
--   2021, you can view metrics for top contributors in Amazon CloudWatch
--   metrics. For more information, see <a>Shield metrics and alarms</a> in
--   the <i>WAF Developer Guide</i>.
newAttackProperty :: AttackProperty

-- | A single attack statistics data record. This is returned by
--   DescribeAttackStatistics along with a time range indicating the time
--   period that the attack statistics apply to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackStatisticsDataItem</a> smart constructor.
data AttackStatisticsDataItem
AttackStatisticsDataItem' :: Maybe AttackVolume -> Integer -> AttackStatisticsDataItem

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackStatisticsDataItem</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackVolume:AttackStatisticsDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>attackStatisticsDataItem_attackVolume</a> - Information about the
--   volume of attacks during the time period. If the accompanying
--   <tt>AttackCount</tt> is zero, this setting might be empty.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackCount:AttackStatisticsDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>attackStatisticsDataItem_attackCount</a> - The number of attacks
--   detected during the time period. This is always present, but might be
--   zero.
newAttackStatisticsDataItem :: Integer -> AttackStatisticsDataItem

-- | Summarizes all DDoS attacks for a specified time period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AttackSummary
AttackSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AttackVectorDescription] -> AttackSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:AttackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>attackSummary_resourceArn</a> - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of
--   the resource that was attacked.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:AttackSummary'</a>, <a>attackSummary_startTime</a> -
--   The start time of the attack, in Unix time in seconds. For more
--   information see <a>timestamp</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:AttackSummary'</a>, <a>attackSummary_endTime</a> - The
--   end time of the attack, in Unix time in seconds. For more information
--   see <a>timestamp</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackId:AttackSummary'</a>, <a>attackSummary_attackId</a> -
--   The unique identifier (ID) of the attack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackVectors:AttackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>attackSummary_attackVectors</a> - The list of attacks for a
--   specified time period.
newAttackSummary :: AttackSummary

-- | Describes the attack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackVectorDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AttackVectorDescription
AttackVectorDescription' :: Text -> AttackVectorDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackVectorDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vectorType:AttackVectorDescription'</a>,
--   <a>attackVectorDescription_vectorType</a> - The attack type. Valid
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>UDP_TRAFFIC</li>
--   <li>UDP_FRAGMENT</li>
--   <li>GENERIC_UDP_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>DNS_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>NTP_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>CHARGEN_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>SSDP_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>PORT_MAPPER</li>
--   <li>RIP_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>SNMP_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>MSSQL_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>NET_BIOS_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>SYN_FLOOD</li>
--   <li>ACK_FLOOD</li>
--   <li>REQUEST_FLOOD</li>
--   <li>HTTP_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>UDS_REFLECTION</li>
--   <li>MEMCACHED_REFLECTION</li>
--   </ul>
newAttackVectorDescription :: Text -> AttackVectorDescription

-- | Information about the volume of attacks during the time period,
--   included in an AttackStatisticsDataItem. If the accompanying
--   <tt>AttackCount</tt> in the statistics object is zero, this setting
--   might be empty.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackVolume</a> smart constructor.
data AttackVolume
AttackVolume' :: Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics -> Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics -> Maybe AttackVolumeStatistics -> AttackVolume

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:packetsPerSecond:AttackVolume'</a>,
--   <a>attackVolume_packetsPerSecond</a> - A statistics object that uses
--   packets per second as the unit. This is included for network level
--   attacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bitsPerSecond:AttackVolume'</a>,
--   <a>attackVolume_bitsPerSecond</a> - A statistics object that uses bits
--   per second as the unit. This is included for network level attacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestsPerSecond:AttackVolume'</a>,
--   <a>attackVolume_requestsPerSecond</a> - A statistics object that uses
--   requests per second as the unit. This is included for application
--   level attacks, and is only available for accounts that are subscribed
--   to Shield Advanced.
newAttackVolume :: AttackVolume

-- | Statistics objects for the various data types in AttackVolume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttackVolumeStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data AttackVolumeStatistics
AttackVolumeStatistics' :: Double -> AttackVolumeStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>AttackVolumeStatistics</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:max:AttackVolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>attackVolumeStatistics_max</a> - The maximum attack volume observed
--   for the given unit.
newAttackVolumeStatistics :: Double -> AttackVolumeStatistics

-- | A contributor to the attack and their contribution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContributor</a> smart constructor.
data Contributor
Contributor' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Contributor

-- | Create a value of <a>Contributor</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Contributor'</a>, <a>contributor_name</a> - The name of
--   the contributor. This is dependent on the
--   <tt>AttackPropertyIdentifier</tt>. For example, if the
--   <tt>AttackPropertyIdentifier</tt> is <tt>SOURCE_COUNTRY</tt>, the
--   <tt>Name</tt> could be <tt>United States</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Contributor'</a>, <a>contributor_value</a> - The
--   contribution of this contributor expressed in Protection units. For
--   example <tt>10,000</tt>.
newContributor :: Contributor

-- | Contact information that the SRT can use to contact you if you have
--   proactive engagement enabled, for escalations to the SRT and to
--   initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmergencyContact</a> smart constructor.
data EmergencyContact
EmergencyContact' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> EmergencyContact

-- | Create a value of <a>EmergencyContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:EmergencyContact'</a>,
--   <a>emergencyContact_phoneNumber</a> - The phone number for the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactNotes:EmergencyContact'</a>,
--   <a>emergencyContact_contactNotes</a> - Additional notes regarding the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailAddress:EmergencyContact'</a>,
--   <a>emergencyContact_emailAddress</a> - The email address for the
--   contact.
newEmergencyContact :: Text -> EmergencyContact

-- | Specifies how many protections of a given type you can create.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLimit</a> smart constructor.
data Limit
Limit' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Limit

-- | Create a value of <a>Limit</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:max:Limit'</a>, <a>limit_max</a> - The maximum number of
--   protections that can be created for the specified <tt>Type</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Limit'</a>, <a>limit_type</a> - The type of protection.
newLimit :: Limit

-- | The mitigation applied to a DDoS attack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigation</a> smart constructor.
data Mitigation
Mitigation' :: Maybe Text -> Mitigation

-- | Create a value of <a>Mitigation</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mitigationName:Mitigation'</a>,
--   <a>mitigation_mitigationName</a> - The name of the mitigation taken
--   for this attack.
newMitigation :: Mitigation

-- | An object that represents a resource that is under DDoS protection.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtection</a> smart constructor.
data Protection
Protection' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Protection

-- | Create a value of <a>Protection</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:Protection'</a>, <a>protection_resourceArn</a> -
--   The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Amazon Web Services resource
--   that is protected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionArn:Protection'</a>, <a>protection_protectionArn</a>
--   - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the protection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Protection'</a>, <a>protection_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of the protection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Protection'</a>, <a>protection_name</a> - The name of the
--   protection. For example, <tt>My CloudFront distributions</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheckIds:Protection'</a>,
--   <a>protection_healthCheckIds</a> - The unique identifier (ID) for the
--   Route 53 health check that's associated with the protection.
newProtection :: Protection

-- | A grouping of protected resources that you and Shield Advanced can
--   monitor as a collective. This resource grouping improves the accuracy
--   of detection and reduces false positives.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectionGroup</a> smart constructor.
data ProtectionGroup
ProtectionGroup' :: Maybe ProtectedResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ProtectionGroupAggregation -> ProtectionGroupPattern -> [Text] -> ProtectionGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtectionGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroup_resourceType</a> - The resource type to include in
--   the protection group. All protected resources of this type are
--   included in the protection group. You must set this when you set
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> to <tt>BY_RESOURCE_TYPE</tt> and you must not set it
--   for any other <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionGroupArn:ProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroup_protectionGroupArn</a> - The ARN (Amazon Resource
--   Name) of the protection group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionGroupId:ProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroup_protectionGroupId</a> - The name of the protection
--   group. You use this to identify the protection group in lists and to
--   manage the protection group, for example to update, delete, or
--   describe it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aggregation:ProtectionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroup_aggregation</a> - Defines how Shield combines
--   resource data for the group in order to detect, mitigate, and report
--   events.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Sum - Use the total traffic across the group. This is a good
--   choice for most cases. Examples include Elastic IP addresses for EC2
--   instances that scale manually or automatically.</li>
--   <li>Mean - Use the average of the traffic across the group. This is a
--   good choice for resources that share traffic uniformly. Examples
--   include accelerators and load balancers.</li>
--   <li>Max - Use the highest traffic from each resource. This is useful
--   for resources that don't share traffic and for resources that share
--   that traffic in a non-uniform way. Examples include Amazon CloudFront
--   distributions and origin resources for CloudFront distributions.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:pattern':ProtectionGroup'</a>, <a>protectionGroup_pattern</a>
--   - The criteria to use to choose the protected resources for inclusion
--   in the group. You can include all resources that have protections,
--   provide a list of resource Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), or include
--   all resources of a specified resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:members:ProtectionGroup'</a>, <a>protectionGroup_members</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the resources to include in the
--   protection group. You must set this when you set <tt>Pattern</tt> to
--   <tt>ARBITRARY</tt> and you must not set it for any other
--   <tt>Pattern</tt> setting.
newProtectionGroup :: Text -> ProtectionGroupAggregation -> ProtectionGroupPattern -> ProtectionGroup

-- | Limits settings on protection groups with arbitrary pattern type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits
ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits' :: Integer -> ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxMembers:ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits_maxMembers</a> - The maximum
--   number of resources you can specify for a single arbitrary pattern in
--   a protection group.
newProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits :: Integer -> ProtectionGroupArbitraryPatternLimits

-- | Limits settings on protection groups for your subscription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectionGroupLimits</a> smart constructor.
data ProtectionGroupLimits
ProtectionGroupLimits' :: Integer -> ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits -> ProtectionGroupLimits

--   fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   of protection groups that you can have at one time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:patternTypeLimits:ProtectionGroupLimits'</a>,
--   <a>protectionGroupLimits_patternTypeLimits</a> - Limits settings by
--   pattern type in the protection groups for your subscription.
newProtectionGroupLimits :: Integer -> ProtectionGroupPatternTypeLimits -> ProtectionGroupLimits

-- | The attack information for the specified SubResource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubResourceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data SubResourceSummary

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>subResourceSummary_counters</a> - The counters that describe the
--   details of the attack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:SubResourceSummary'</a>, <a>subResourceSummary_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the <tt>SubResource</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SubResourceSummary'</a>, <a>subResourceSummary_type</a>
--   - The <tt>SubResource</tt> type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attackVectors:SubResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>subResourceSummary_attackVectors</a> - The list of attack types and
--   associated counters.
newSubResourceSummary :: SubResourceSummary

-- | Information about the Shield Advanced subscription for an account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscription</a> smart constructor.
data Subscription
Subscription' :: Maybe AutoRenew -> Maybe ProactiveEngagementStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Limit] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> SubscriptionLimits -> Subscription

-- | Create a value of <a>Subscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoRenew:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_autoRenew</a> -
--   If <tt>ENABLED</tt>, the subscription will be automatically renewed at
--   the end of the existing subscription period.
--   
--   When you initally create a subscription, <tt>AutoRenew</tt> is set to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt>. You can change this by submitting an
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request. If the
--   <tt>UpdateSubscription</tt> request does not included a value for
--   <tt>AutoRenew</tt>, the existing value for <tt>AutoRenew</tt> remains
--   unchanged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:proactiveEngagementStatus:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_proactiveEngagementStatus</a> - If <tt>ENABLED</tt>,
--   the Shield Response Team (SRT) will use email and phone to notify
--   contacts about escalations to the SRT and to initiate proactive
--   customer support.
--   
--   If <tt>PENDING</tt>, you have requested proactive engagement and the
--   request is pending. The status changes to <tt>ENABLED</tt> when your
--   request is fully processed.
--   
--   If <tt>DISABLED</tt>, the SRT will not proactively notify contacts
--   about escalations or to initiate proactive customer support.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_startTime</a> -
--   The start time of the subscription, in Unix time in seconds. For more
--   information see <a>timestamp</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_endTime</a> - The
--   date and time your subscription will end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_limits</a> -
--   Specifies how many protections of a given type you can create.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionArn:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_subscriptionArn</a> - The ARN (Amazon Resource Name)
--   of the subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeCommitmentInSeconds:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_timeCommitmentInSeconds</a> - The length, in seconds,
--   of the Shield Advanced subscription for the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionLimits:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_subscriptionLimits</a> - Limits settings for your
--   subscription.
newSubscription :: SubscriptionLimits -> Subscription

-- | Limits settings for your subscription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscriptionLimits</a> smart constructor.
data SubscriptionLimits

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   
--   <a>$sel:protectionGroupLimits:SubscriptionLimits'</a>,
--   <a>subscriptionLimits_protectionGroupLimits</a> - Limits settings on
--   protection groups for your subscription.
newSubscriptionLimits :: ProtectionLimits -> ProtectionGroupLimits -> SubscriptionLimits

-- | A summary of information about the attack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSummarizedAttackVector</a> smart constructor.
data SummarizedAttackVector
SummarizedAttackVector' :: Maybe [SummarizedCounter] -> Text -> SummarizedAttackVector

-- | Create a value of <a>SummarizedAttackVector</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vectorCounters:SummarizedAttackVector'</a>,
--   <a>summarizedAttackVector_vectorCounters</a> - The list of counters
--   that describe the details of the attack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vectorType:SummarizedAttackVector'</a>,
--   <a>summarizedAttackVector_vectorType</a> - The attack type, for
--   example, SNMP reflection or SYN flood.
newSummarizedAttackVector :: Text -> SummarizedAttackVector

-- | The counter that describes a DDoS attack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSummarizedCounter</a> smart constructor.
data SummarizedCounter
SummarizedCounter' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> SummarizedCounter

-- | Create a value of <a>SummarizedCounter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:n:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_n</a> - The
--   number of counters for a specified time period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_unit</a> -
--   The unit of the counters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sum:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_sum</a> - The
--   total of counter values for a specified time period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_name</a> -
--   The counter name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:max:SummarizedCounter'</a>, <a>summarizedCounter_max</a> - The
--   maximum value of the counter for a specified time period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:average:SummarizedCounter'</a>,
--   <a>summarizedCounter_average</a> - The average value of the counter
--   for a specified time period.
newSummarizedCounter :: SummarizedCounter

-- | A tag associated with an Amazon Web Services resource. Tags are
--   key:value pairs that you can use to categorize and manage your
--   resources, for purposes like billing or other management. Typically,
--   the tag key represents a category, such as "environment", and the tag
--   value represents a specific value within that category, such as
--   "test," "development," or "production". Or you might set the tag key
--   to "customer" and the value to the customer name or ID. You can
--   specify one or more tags to add to each Amazon Web Services resource,
--   up to 50 tags for a resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Part of the key:value pair that
--   defines a tag. You can use a tag key to describe a category of
--   information, such as "customer." Tag keys are case-sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Part of the key:value pair
--   that defines a tag. You can use a tag value to describe a specific
--   value within a category, such as "companyA" or "companyB." Tag values
--   are case-sensitive.
newTag :: Tag

-- | The time range.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data TimeRange
TimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> TimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeRange</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The start time, in Unix time in seconds. For more information see
--   <a>timestamp</a>.

--   <a>$sel:toExclusive:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_toExclusive</a> - The
--   end time, in Unix time in seconds. For more information see
--   <a>timestamp</a>.
newTimeRange :: TimeRange
